result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamaul B Pitts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $1579.13 to Cynthia T. over probation; any balance converted into civil judgment. Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation; any balance converted into civil judgment. Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain HSED or GED.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Cynthia T. 4821 N 52nd Street, 5164 N 61st Street, Nicholas M., Tyler C.

Cooperate with the Department.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens,
Complete DV counseling course--not anger management.
Maintain weekly contact with Charles R. Jr.
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge over probation.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.

Defendant Shamaul B Pitts in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Shamaul B Pitts in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 33 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.  This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 4 years.  Upon revocation the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of Probation and extended supervision:
-1 year HOC condition time-straignt time; last 4 months may be served at the DRC if found eligible
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Complete DV counseling course-not anger management
-No contact with Cynthia T. 4821 N 5nd street, 5164 N 61st Street, Nicholas M., Tyler C.
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED
Maintain weekly contact with Charles R. Jr.
Defendant to pay restitution of $1,579.13 to Cynthia T. over probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge over probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant 
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over probation; any balance converted into civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shamaul B Pitts in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordes presentence investigation.  Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession / Voting.  Defendant to show verification for school enrollment.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Richard M. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shamaul B Pitts in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/3/14.

Defendant Shamaul B Pitts in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Shamaul B Pitts in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
